TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed Alignment extends System.Enum

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Specifies the alignment of a rendered object. This class cannot be inherited. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment> enumeration represents the horizontal positioning of an item on its parent container, such as a panel or form. For example, if you add an image to a form, you can set its horizontal position to align with the right side of the form.
Although you can use the bit values in scripting languages, you cannot use them with ASP.NET. For example, `Alignment = "2"` within a panel tag is not a valid statement. However, in Visual C#, you can use `this.myPanel.Alignment = 2`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment Center = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Aligns with the center of the screen. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Docs.summary: Aligns with the left of the screen. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment NotSet = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Default value. If the value is , then the alignment is inherited from the control's style, or, if the style is not defined, from the control's parent control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
